website_summaries.verdict: A pair of lightweight gloves that have a chloroprene rubber palm to help absorb vibrations.
pros: Ergodyne's gloves are molded with a slight curve to help aid with comfort and dexterity
They are manufactured using a breathable cotton and nylon knit which keeps the gloves lightweight
The fabric also can help the gloves stay snug while you are working
cons: Depending on the type of work that you are doing, these gloves can wear more quickly than anticipated

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Using an random orbital sander (ROS) for extended periods of time with these gloves and the constant vibration doesn't effect my hands the way it would either bare handed or with regular gloves. The only real downside to these gloves is that they are bulky and hard to close your grip for fine work, so you have to take the gloves off if you need to do that. Fortunately the glove are easy to put on and take off. Great for use with vibrating machinery, I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Crimson Doc

customer_reviews.title: Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I was unaware that such a product existed until i was using my demo hammer extensively for week after week and my fingers began to tingle. i looked into it and found that these gloves protect you from such effects of using high vibration equipment. Other users are correct, the gloves are a bit clunky. Fortunately my demo hammer has just an on/off switch and not a trigger. I do feel a reduction is vibration on my first day in using them and am pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.author: JAK

customer_reviews.title: They fit My American XL hands
customer_reviews.text: When I saw on the package that these were made in Japan I said, “ Well, gentlemen, place your bets”. I lost the bet. They fit real well. The foam cushioning material seems to have the right give. I am getting old. My hands are not recovering very well from running my chainsaw anymore. So when these wear out - I will be buying a another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Born & raised  in Iowa, can't get used to the weather.

customer_reviews.title: Great for trimming
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these gloves for a little over two years, and mostly used for trimming. I have tried one other brand of anti vibration gloves and these are significantly better. These are Not your traditional work gloves and not intended to be used for the rigors of moving wood, limbs, rocks, or exposure to chemicals. If you use them to protect against vibration from power tools, they’ll have longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Yepit'sme

customer_reviews.title: Saved my numb/tingling hands
customer_reviews.text: Riding my mowers around for 2-3 hours would leave my hands numb and/or tingling that night, into the next morning. Uncomfortable, to say the least. Wearing these gloves while mowing prevents this from happening. As a bonus, the rubber gives me a better grip on the wheel. Also, they are not uncomfortable or hot, even in the peak of summer. I have average hands (I guess) and chose the XL and they fit nicely for me.
customer_reviews.author: M. Garretson

customer_reviews.title: Effective anti-vibration gloves
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Ergodyne anti-vibration gloves. They work well when using an air impact wrench or angle grinder. What's nice is all of the foam padding in the fingers. Many of other anti-vibration gloves have a relatively thin layer of padding that isn't as effective. The main drawback is the mesh back section of the gloves. When using an angle grinder on steel, the openings in the mesh allow sparks to get through and don't protect your skin very well. The mesh also begins to tear after awhile, which makes it even less protective.
customer_reviews.author: Scooter1908

customer_reviews.title: I use these when gardening. Helped with my arthritis
customer_reviews.text: My hands hurt like crazy after doing yard work. I bought these gloves to use when mowing and edging. My hand pain has pretty much gone away. I recommend these to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Brewster Cogburn

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome
customer_reviews.text: I think whatever these gloves are made of attracts yellow jackets. I got stung more over the course of the first few days I had these than in the rest of my life. I got stung everywhere but they clustered on the gloves even after I took them off and they can sting right through the back of them. My hand looked like a catcher's mitt. They definitely keep the vibrations down and more or less fixed the numbing I was getting in my hands. Would recommend but seriously watch out for Yellow Jackets, everyone else on my crew was wearing leathers and the wasps left them alone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to close your grip
customer_reviews.text: I am used to wear thick bulky impact gloves but these gloves surprised me with how difficult it is to close your hands and grip something. So far the gloves have helped my hands against HAVS which is the reason I ordered them. Time will tell if they loosen up after more use and become easier to grip with.
customer_reviews.author: TJW

customer_reviews.title: Women work too.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a woman and work. I want a glove that fits and provides vibration protection. Because this glove isn't made in womens sizes, and isn't available in a men's small, I had to get a size medium. This is SO irritating. Who knows if this glove is comfortable or not, I can't get it to fit. And it wears out because it slides around. Make the gloves available in women's sizes, this is 2019... we aren't just baby makers and cooks.
customer_reviews.author: mkiernan

customer_reviews.title: great product for jackhammering
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to run a 60 lb jack-hammer. They work nicely and I was happy I bought them. It in no way eliminates the suffering of hard work, lol but it does make a difference. I can see how others had a problem with a trigger operation like a roto-hammer because they are bulky but for an open grip like our electric jackhammer, they worked great. Wished I had found them years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Richards

customer_reviews.title: I'm impressed by these.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to protect my hand while using a needle scaler on a large industrial nh3 refrigeration repaint job. After over 50 hours of heavy use they are still holding up and my hands aren't all achy like usual. I definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Flexible, do the job well.
customer_reviews.text: Great for dampening some of the vibration from a lawnmower or weedwacker. Won't eliminate it, but makes it more tolerable. Gloves are very flexible, but there is some loss of dexterity due to the thickness of the padding. This was expected, but the dexterity is still better than some larger, gel-pad type gloves I also have.
customer_reviews.author: 2Mutts

customer_reviews.title: No more Numb hands
customer_reviews.text: This make a world of difference when using a lawnmower or weed wacker. Before my hands would start getting numb from all the vibration transmitted through the handles, now with these ProFlex 9000 gloves it's barely noticeable. I would estimate an 80% drop in vibration transmitted to my hands. These also have the added benefit of giving great grip so you don't have to squeeze as hard to hold on tight.
customer_reviews.author: VortextuaL

customer_reviews.title: The smell is a bit funny, but the product itself has a very thick ...
customer_reviews.text: As someone who has mild degree of carpel tunnel , this pair has been the difference between me sitting on my couch and me burning calories in my garden. The smell is a bit funny, but the product itself has a very thick padding which does the work.
customer_reviews.author: KinV

customer_reviews.title: Let me first state that the only reason this is ...
customer_reviews.text: Let me first state that the only reason this is a 4 star vs 5 star rating is their durability. They do help reduce vibration from air tools or otherwise. I do track work on the railroad, and unfortunately regardless of brand or seemingly tough durability I burn through gloves in a week. These are very important to help reduce damage to nerves which can cause hand arm vibration syndrome, or carpal tunnel. Do yourself a favor if working with any vibrating tool and buy yourself a pair or three of these. Fits perfectly as measured
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Ciricillo

customer_reviews.title: The concept for these gloves is good. However
customer_reviews.text: The concept for these gloves is good. However, in practicality it lacks. The palm of the gloves are made of rubber bumps, as you can see. This makes the gloves very "fat", if you will, and gripping the handles of tools and such is cumbersome and a lot of work for the muscles in your hands. That's exactly what I was trying to avoid--overworking my hands! I am a female, however, and I'm sure the gloves were designed for a man. Even the smallest size is too large for me. Perhaps if used often enough, you might break the gloves in, and they'd be far more effective.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Very very happy!
customer_reviews.text: I have a major problem with vibration syndrome. If I use a power tool that vibrates my hands may go numb for a week or more. Nothing to mess with as it can become permanent. Anyway these gloves work wonderfully great at cutting down on the vibrations transmitted from my random orbital sander to my hands. No numbness at all ! Would buy again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: RAS

customer_reviews.title: Work well for wood chipper
customer_reviews.text: I use these to feed branches into a chipper and they help a lot. They are wearing very quickly and don't stop thorns, but my hands don't hurt after a day of mulching branches. Even if they only last for twenty days, the price per day for pain avoidance is worth it to me.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Pigwillow

customer_reviews.title: They are sort of like tires.
customer_reviews.text: These wear out, just like tires. The more work hours you put on them, the sooner they will need to be replaced. They are not supposed to be washable, but I started washing them in a mesh bag in my washer machine because I like to occasionally remove oils, pesticides, and stenches from them. I used these primarily for weed-whacking and with a commercial lawn mower. I got about 4.5 months' worth of use out of them with 50-70 hour work weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Protty

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I've always chosen this brand because their products last very long. Working in the oilfields, this is great for people who use high powered hand tools everyday. They will save your hands from vibration stress and aches. The benefits outweigh the negative reviews from some who complain that you can't perform small tasks with these gloves. It's simple. Just have another thinner pair with more dexterity for small tasks, then put these back on for the big job and git her done.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier Viveros

customer_reviews.title: Must have for power tool use
customer_reviews.text: Makes handling power tools like angle grinders mush easier on your hands
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: better than nothing
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to address fatigue and tingly hands from extended use of a variety of power equipment. I'd say they help somewhat. They are not the ultimate answer. The knit glove is snug on my medium hands - a bit of a struggle to put on and off, but they do stay on. I was glad to find that they were usable in 100 degree heat, not too warm. The spongy ribs on the fingers and palm are thick, so these aren't gloves you would use for anything else. I can't say anything about the durability yet, but looks like they will be OK.
customer_reviews.author: tony

customer_reviews.title: Marginal at best
customer_reviews.text: Used on a sanding project to reduce vibration fatigue of sanders. Product worked ok, but was very hot to wear and reduced vibration by about 20%. Overall, not bad, but was hoping for more.
customer_reviews.author: Multi-day traveler

customer_reviews.title: ProFlex 9000 Glove
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son as he got a job where he had to run a weed eater for maybe an hour a day. He plays the banjo and I didn't want his hand ruined. He used them all summer and I tried them here at home. I can say that they work, no question about it. I ran the weedeater for about a half an hour and normally my hand would be numb for a while. With these gloves they felt fine, no tingly feeling. Don't now how long they will last but they seem fine after one season.
customer_reviews.author: Wednesday

customer_reviews.title: Definitely provide some relief as designed
customer_reviews.text: Quite an improvement over typical insulated gloves, for reducing vibration. Still not perfect, but a noticeable improvement. They fit well and they do provide some relief for people who are bothered by vibration -in my case -from lawnmowers
customer_reviews.author: looking4work

customer_reviews.title: They were comfortable and no more tingling in my hands
customer_reviews.text: I ahd a lot of sanding to do on my deck using a mouse sander. After a day of sanding, my hands felt tingly for a full day later. I bought and used these every day after. They were comfortable and no more tingling in my hands.
customer_reviews.author: S. Spachtholz

customer_reviews.title: Just had an operation - let me shoot my shotgun
customer_reviews.text: Broke a finger. Used this to hold my shotgun days after getting screws in my finger. Let me shoot my shotgun without issues. Use only with doctor approval... worked for me.
customer_reviews.author: Metroid

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Worked pretty good but hard to tell how long it would really last.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Look no further
customer_reviews.text: These gloves work perfect, I worked with a hand grinder all day, before I had these gloves my hands were sore after work, when I started using these, no more pain
customer_reviews.author: william springstead

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to drive a army truck which had bad vibrations when driving . Truck is a lot better now I replace the track rod end, but gloves are great. I had numb fingers and was really worried about permanent injury, but now now worries and I use the glove when ever I drive that truck incase. I think they’d be good for any vibrating power tool. I’d actuslly like to see this sort of design incorporated into MTb gloves etc.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Durable!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these do do lawn work and cut the grass. They are extremely durable and cuts down on the vibration from my lawn mower. I even washed these gloves and put them in the dryer by mistake. They are still intact!!!
customer_reviews.author: PAULA SALDARRIAGA

customer_reviews.title: Great for wet environments.
customer_reviews.text: Better than expected based on some prior reviews. Especially something to consider if working in a wet environment as these gloves dry out quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Lajos P.

customer_reviews.title: Seem a little light weight
customer_reviews.text: Seem to work I was able to sand longer than usual. But I'm afraid under long term use the gloves may not hold up
customer_reviews.author: eric scott

customer_reviews.title: my husband has been doing a lot of sanding it ...
customer_reviews.text: my husband has been doing a lot of sanding it was having problems with hands because of it - these gloves have improved his symptoms significantly
customer_reviews.author: neem

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for working in the gym. Pull ups and dead lifts were killing my hands. With these gloves, problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: John H. White

customer_reviews.title: ... hands/arms while using my push lawn mower which rattles like crazy. They worked just as I had hoped ...
customer_reviews.text: These protected my hands/arms while using my push lawn mower which rattles like crazy. They worked just as I had hoped to relieve the vibration.
customer_reviews.author: LSH

customer_reviews.title: Hand saver. Don't listen to others
customer_reviews.text: These gloves really do decrease the amount of vibration that gets to your hand. They do not completely stop it but they do dampen it. They are Los not too cumbersome to where you can't change sanding pads. I haven't had. Problem with wear. Use with bosch sanders and festool sanders.
customer_reviews.author: C. Mac

customer_reviews.title: Good Vibration Protection But Too Bulky
customer_reviews.text: Good gloves for vibration issues but I find them too bulky for Weed eating. Had to cut the fingertips for more mobility. Was actually making my hands cramp up more because of the bulkiness. Would probably be great for a jackhammer.
customer_reviews.author: mcagee

customer_reviews.title: gloves worked great, i have a much more expensive pair of ...
customer_reviews.text: gloves worked great, i have a much more expensive pair of jackhammer gloves, but they are a pain to get on and off. these are much easier, the black fabric allows for great air flow. i would purchase these again and would recommend them
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great for neutralizing the effects of vibration.
customer_reviews.text: I work with hand-held grinders, drills and impacts and my hands were feeling the pain from all the vibration, so I purchased these gloves and my hands are feeling normal again. I use leather gloves over these to protect them from wearing out.
customer_reviews.author: BrownsFan71

customer_reviews.title: Works well, just smells.
customer_reviews.text: Often when using intense grinders my hands go numb in minutes. With these, Im good to go, still feeling vibrations, but i still have feel in my hands. My only real complainant is that the rubber that is insulating smells quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hewko

customer_reviews.title: Fits well but very stiff.
customer_reviews.text: These fit well, but they are very stiff. It takes some effort to bend my fingers in these gloves when using the weed wacker. They don't absorb as much vibration as I expected,.
customer_reviews.author: Pes

customer_reviews.title: However- they arrived quickly and appear to be good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Gloves were not as lightweight as anticipated- too bulk for intended use (reduce vibration during motocross riding). However- they arrived quickly and appear to be good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Cookie

customer_reviews.title: Thought it was good but it wasnt
customer_reviews.text: Didn't help my bf like they were supposed to. Still hands are hurting but what else can you do. !
customer_reviews.author: savy pickles

customer_reviews.title: Gel bike gloves work better than these
customer_reviews.text: Gel bike gloves work better than these. Useless for using a string trimmer. They do nothing for vibration and make it almost impossible to hold onto anything. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Hammer71

customer_reviews.title: I purchased these to reduce the vibration of the lawn ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to reduce the vibration of the lawn mover (nerve issues). Unfortunately, didn't work at all but they're constructed well so I'll use them for non-vibrating objects
customer_reviews.author: 3girls520

customer_reviews.title: Really Works
customer_reviews.text: Prior to using these gloves, my hands would be numb after a few hours with the gas string trimmer. Now, I can go all day with these glove on.
customer_reviews.author: 808Dejavu

customer_reviews.title: Fast delivery but gloves don't fit right. Just the ...
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery but gloves don't fit right. Just the thumbs are too long they bend over and I still have to take them off to use my iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: These gloves remove almost all the vibration of a gas powered weed eater. LOVE em.
customer_reviews.author: lockpicker_1973

customer_reviews.title: Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I have not used them enough to rate duribility, otherwise satisified.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Muntean

customer_reviews.title: Definitely good at blocking out vibrations
customer_reviews.text: Definitely good at blocking out vibrations, wish it was made of some more durable material though considering how hot they get during the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Saves my hands!
customer_reviews.text: Over the years, first as a programmer, and then as a full time woodworker, I have developed issues such as carpal tunnel and tendonitis. These gloves allow me to work comfortably, and avoid further aggravation of these issues.
customer_reviews.author: George Saridakis

customer_reviews.title: These left me use the monster thing for a good hour easily
customer_reviews.text: I have a powerful but vibration prone leaf blower that left my hands numb after even10 minutes of use. These left me use the monster thing for a good hour easily. At which point other parts of me where too tired to keep going, not my hands. The rubber is really thick, so deducts some strength overhead away from gripping-power on the tool because the gloves do resist you closing your hand. But I think if the rubber was thinner then it wouldn't soak up the vibration as nicely. And the thick layer does destroy your dexterity. But considering I am just ham-fisting a leaf blower these worked out well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M.

customer_reviews.title: Ok. To bulky for hedge trimmer, weed eater ...
customer_reviews.text: Ok. To bulky for hedge trimmer, weed eater and chain saw. It does cut down on the vibration. Just to bulky
customer_reviews.author: Roger B.

customer_reviews.title: I bought this cause at my job they have us ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cause at my job they have us air chiseling cement inside tanks and this product never worked it made my hands fatigue
customer_reviews.author: Rebel Dew

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: finally my hand and elbow do not hurt after running the yard equipment
customer_reviews.author: Joseph & Tracy Beird

customer_reviews.title: keep looking.
customer_reviews.text: not much in the way of anti vibration. don't buy, there are better ones out there.
customer_reviews.author: Maple Lawn Staff

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these for his arthritic hands. Second pair!
customer_reviews.author: lzrd2007

customer_reviews.title: superior cushioning
customer_reviews.text: I have carpal tunnel and continue outdoor work with and without manual and power tools. These gloves are excellent cushions in all instances. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor O

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Really thick, I bought them to edger and weedwaker vibration, these protect the best against vibration. Although my hands feel a slight tingles after, I've come to the conclusion that nothing will fully eliminate the vibration but these gloves help a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Bill B

customer_reviews.title: Works great, they are a bit thicker than I was ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, they are a bit thicker than I was expecting, it took some getting use to working with them, I use a grinder all day, and these take a lot of my pain away, they have excellent grip as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Effective
customer_reviews.text: These help my husband when he mows - they absorb vibrations and help keep his hands from bothering him afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: JillT

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I can use the weed wacker for hours with these gloves
customer_reviews.author: Natuna Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Going to use for golf gloves due to golfers elbow!
customer_reviews.author: Alan Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad buy for the money
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad buy for the money. They have held up well. Cheaper then the Proflex 9015F and they lasted alot longer.
customer_reviews.author: Greg R Laubmeier

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Seems well padded. Will update review after use. Made in Japan
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t reduce the vibration of my weed wacker as much as I’d hoped. Still, very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: I can work with the mower and trimmer for a long time without my fingers tingling. Helps to prevent a vibration type injury.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Walton

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These anti vibration gloves work well using a Jack hammer.
customer_reviews.author: grglga

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: does not fully prevent but certainly does help keep hands from vibrating.
customer_reviews.author: Emmett

customer_reviews.title: Price
customer_reviews.text: Great quality gloves. Really helps reduce vibration of weedeater & blower.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Tauzin

customer_reviews.title: only adequate
customer_reviews.text: As antivibration gloves these are only adequate. Really need gel type to work better, they are easy to wear and to filter out most of vibration energy.
customer_reviews.author: drjohn

customer_reviews.title: Work pretty well. Used multiple pairs of gloves in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Work pretty well. Used multiple pairs of gloves in the past.
customer_reviews.author: William G Kiger

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: These gloves do cut way down on the vibration from using a weed eater but they are very thick and bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: My husband says these are awesome! He was having hand numbness due to using ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband says these are awesome! He was having hand numbness due to using a grinder and these have helped tremendously with reducing vibrations.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah K.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great for cushioning hands for use with random orbital sander
customer_reviews.author: Chris Cadwell

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: They seem to work good for now. Interested to see how they hold up.
customer_reviews.author: jon hammer

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: They work. I was able to pressure-wash for 12 hours with these and my hands didn't have the usual buzz lasting for days.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Adams

customer_reviews.title: Sufficient protection
customer_reviews.text: The glove seems to do what its intended for. Have been using it at work cutting metal with a reciprocating saw. The padding though may be too constrictive for fine motor skill type of activity, e.g. pulling trigger on the reciprocating saw.
customer_reviews.author: Filomeno F Ladera

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding for AV.
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, outstanding grip. keep relatively cool on the backside. These appear top be same glove that is sold under the Stihl name. They are great for jackhammer and rock drill work. They would likely work equally as well if using a sledge. I don't use them when sawing, but I suppose you could, and it would take most of the vibration out of non-pro saws that are not equipped with AV. The palms are very thick. These are intended for a very specific use, and fulfill that role quite well. They would not be great all-around work gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Salvavida

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: These gloves really helped on a 12 hour job I just did. I was able to run a brush cutter all day with no tingling in my fingers hands at all. I should have ordered a small for my hands but still did the trick
customer_reviews.author: Tina Myers

customer_reviews.title: Good Vibration Reduction
customer_reviews.text: These gloves do a good job of reducing vibration when using a chainsaw or brush saw: The open weave of the material on the back gives almost no resistance to thorn penetration or wind penetration so they are useless in cold weather: The rubber material is pretty durable although I usually put on leather gloves when I am through cutting for handling the pieces of wood:
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for vibration control
customer_reviews.text: These provide almost no shock reduction, but are really good for basic vibration like mowing - I have advanced arthritic "issues" resulting in lots of bone on bone contact, these really help that - even bought a second pair just in case. They definitely do not smell good and that stays on your hands a while.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Sims

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nicely padded but no dexterity so they didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W Distelhorst

customer_reviews.title: I bought these gloves because we do a LOT of ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves because we do a LOT of sanding in our workshop and I started getting shooting pains up through my hands to my shoulder. These aren't a "cure all", but they've helped tremendously and made the constant sanding much more bearable.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Hard to keep hands in closed position and not a ...
customer_reviews.text: Hard to keep hands in closed position and not a hole lot of different in vibration from a weed eater.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: I jackhammer bridge decks. They lasted 4 days of ...
customer_reviews.text: I jackhammer bridge decks . They lasted 4 days of you know how to hammer . Definitely stoped the blisters but ripped to pieces in 4 days !
customer_reviews.author: Bridgez

customer_reviews.title: Light work only
customer_reviews.text: After 2 days only using them on the jack hammer a handfull of times.the area on the palm between the index finger and thumb started peeling. But there was a slight difference in vibration.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Loveless

product_meta.title: Ergodyne ProFlex 9000 Certified Lightweight Anti-Vibration Work Glove, Large
product_meta.description:
Size:LargeCertified Lightweight AV Gloves: Unique chloroprene rubber palm pad combined with lightweight, breathable cotton/nylon knit.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
When your equipment kicks like a mule, kick back. Get the gloves that specialize in beating your 5-digit beast of burden at its own game. ProFlex Vibration-Reducing Series gloves not only meet ANSI S2.73/ISO 10819-1996 standards, they set a few of their own. The ANSI-certified gloves in the ProFlex Vibration-Reducing series deliver maximum protection against vibration, impact, and shock hazards with patented polymer technology, rugged pigskin, and precise construction. The results are gloves that happily throw themselves between you and dangerous conditions.
feature_bullets: Unique chloroprene rubber palm pad combined with lightweight, breathable cotton/nylon knit.
Lightweight, breathable 7-gauge cotton/nylon seamless knit construction
Pre-curved design provides comfort, dexterity and flexibility with elastic cuff for secure fit
